metadata.title: USN-5928-1 -- systemd vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that systemd did not properly validate the time and accuracy values provided to the format_timespan() function. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a buffer overrun, leading to a denial of service attack. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 ESM, Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. (CVE-2022-3821)  It was discovered that systemd did not properly manage the fs.suid_dumpable kernel configurations. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 22.10. (CVE-2022-4415)  It was discovered that systemd did not properly manage a crash with long backtrace data. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a deadlock, leading to a denial of service attack. This issue only affected Ubuntu 22.10. (CVE-2022-45873)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5928-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  systemd-tests - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-coredump - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-standalone-sysusers - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-container - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libnss-myhostname - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libudev1 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-timesyncd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libsystemd-dev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libnss-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-journal-remote - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libpam-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libudev-dev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libnss-mymachines - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libnss-resolve - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-sysv - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-oomd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-repart - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 libsystemd0 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 udev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7 No subscription required
